value: Elevation of an Interior Wall with Chimneypiece

label: Description
value: A looking glass is in the over mantel. Putti form bases of candelabra on mantle shelf. Flanking mantle are two women carrying baskets on their heads, medallions above, defined by fluted pilasters. In niches on either side are putti playing in shell-shaped fountains.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and black ink, brush and yellow, rose and grey wash

label: Provenance
value: From the Collection of Léon Decloux

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Design for a terminal figure of Charity

label: Description
value: A female half-figure terminating in a pedestal holds two children in her arms. A cloth is loosely draped about her middle. Pedestals decorated with masks and garlands.

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: Elevation of a fountain, composed of three nudes female figures grasping large vases from which water flows. One figure is seen en face, the others in lost profile. The group is on a low base rising above two steps.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and ink, brush and grey washes on paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Design for a Public Monument to be Erected on a Paris Square

label: Description
value: Recto: In the midst of a plaza, above a basin and fountain cloud of mist, is a colossal globe monument, showing Africa, Europe and Asia above the clouds.  On top is a chariot (quadriga) driven by Republican France, accompanied by a winged Liberty. The globe is a symbol of universal equality. People occupy the plaza; some are at the basin's edge. Verso: black chalk sketch of a monument. High pedestal, the bottom part of which is shaped like a tower, rises from narrow basin. At the top stands a figure and chariot.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and gray ink, brush and brown wash over black chalk, graphite on white laid paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: Drawing of two long branches. Upper left, bouquets of small blue flowers; lower left, small blue flowered bunches with red inverted cone shapes on top; upper right, red rose like flowers sitting on top of feather-like bases.

label: Provenance
value: Unidentified collector (Lugt S., 1953b); Leon Decloux; 1911: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Sprays of Seven ideal Flowers and of one quasi naturalistic flower

label: Description
value: Disposed in three horizontal rows. Several groups of fantastical flowers on branches and one naturalistic group in lower right, all in red and black.

label: Physical description
value: Black, red crayon on cream paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: Trellis architecture, showing at its center a fountain with water spouting from a bird's beak.  In lower right-hand corner, there is a vase of some sort with plants sprouting up from it.  Foliage and wood work mingle as they wind around the center fountain.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and brown ink, brush and gray wash, black chalk on white laid paper

label: Provenance
value: From the Collection of Léon Decloux

Design for Panel Decoration with Rocaille Ornament

label: Description
value: Dado, against which an escutcheon leans. Through an arch a fountain is shown in the distance.

value: Pen and black ink, brush and black and bistre wash on paper

label: Provenance
value: From the Collection of Léon Decloux

Design for Acanthus Rinceaux with Animals and Birds

label: Description
value: Symmetrical arrangement of interlaced acanthus rinceaux interspersed with animals and birds.  Included are salamanders and eagles which are possible references to Federico Gonzaga and family who were important patrons of Giulio Romano.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash, white gouache; scale in graphite added on each side; curving stroke (of a letter?) in pen and brown ink cut off on lower center of sheet

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Notes
value: Symmetrical arrangement of interlaced acanthus rinceaux interspersed with animals and birds. Included are salamanders and eagles which are possible references to Federico Gonzaga and family who were important patrons of Giulio Romano.

label: Description
value: Pairs of pilasters separate the wall panels. The central one is nearly filled by a large folding door. The lateral panels contain rocky niches with fountains. Coffered and domed ceiling.

A pair of trophies referring to the crafts of the cabinet maker and the carpenter

label: Description
value: At left: Tools and a drawing book and ovoidal relief showing a beaver gnawing a pole, suspended from a windlass. At right: tools, drawings, a framed representation of a compass, a carpenter's rule, a snake; suspended from a ribbon.

Design for Cornice of Oblong Ceiling

label: Description
value: One quarter of the ceiling is shown. A circular medallion portrait of a woman is obliquely shown over a satyr mask and festoons in the corner. It is topped by a pair of doves, Cupid and Hymen. The sides are to show censers between acanthus spirals and behind festoons.

label: Description

Other curtains hang from the tops of the door frames. The top part of the wall shows a parapet with vases and panels with classical representations.

value: The elevation of a long and of the greater part of a short wall are shown separated by the section of a niche at the end of the long wall. The walls have respectively, two and one windows. At right, a mantel piece under the window of a short wall. Figures on candelabra are suggested for pilaster strips.

A pilaster beside the door shows a wreath in the dado, a pendant of fruit in the pilaster strip. Near the corner, a pilaster decorated with a thyrsus in the dado, a waved bough in the pilaster strip.

Project for the entrance wall of a salon with alternative suggestions

value: The left and right halves suggest different details. Three shallow niches. In the center is the folding door with a musical trophy as overdoor. At left: A fountain at the foot of a looking glass. At right: a fountain with two mermen and a flower vase. Boardering strip and line.

label: Description
value: Several moldings with and without ornamentation. An ovolo, a leaf, and arrow leaf friezes occur. Bands, in one of which overlapping in another, a rising waved bough with leaves, seeds and flowers is shown; bow-knots are bound around the stem.

value: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash on paper

label: Description
value: Panels of a dado with intertwined waved laurel boughs. A pedestal projects at right showing a female mask crowned with a coronet with a crescent and supporting a filled quiver which is topped by an oak wreath and stands before an oval frame from which the waved ribbons of a bow-knot and flower boughs drag.

value: Pen and dark ink, brush and sepia wash, graphite on paper

label: Description
value: At left, half figures holding a flower basket on her head, above an urn. Set within a frame composed of urns, lozenges and leaf motifs. Right, rectangular panel triangularly quartered with octagonal central panel in which is set an eagle.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and ink, brush and watercolor, graphite on paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: Depiction of a church interior.  The view shown from an oblique angle, depicts a vast, vaulted hall that leads into another, colonnaded hall.  A sepulchral monument is positioned above the arched opening (at the transition to the next hall).  Numerous sculptures and monuments are positioned in wall niches in the main hall. Three small figures and a dog are standing at center.  Additional groups of people are visible in the distance.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and brown and gray ink, brush and wash, watercolor, black chalk on paper, lined with various sheets of paper with printed text in French

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Notes
value: Depiction of a church interior. The view shown from an oblique angle, depicts a vast, vaulted hall that leads into another, colonnaded hall. A sepulchral monument is positioned above the arched opening (at the transition to the next hall). Numerous sculptures and monuments are positioned in wall niches in the main hall. Three small figures and a dog are standing at center. Additional groups of people are visible in the distance.

label: Description
value:
Recto:

Horizontal rectangle. A palace courtyard, bounded by a two-storied building at the rght and an open colonnade in the background. At the left is a fountain showing a basin held aloft by standing figures. Ruined masonry in the left foreground. A tomb at the extreme right. Figures introduced into the scene. 

Verso:

Rough sketch of a building or street scene. Undecipherable notes (in pencil) in French, below.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and brown ink with chinese ink wash; verso: pencil and black chalk

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Section of the Wings and Elevation of a Wall on the Court, Palazzo Farnese, Rome

label: Description
value: Section of a large, three-story building.  Section through the middle line of the court, the vestibule being at the left.  The elevation of the southeastern side of the court and section of the main and the rear wings are shown.  Measurements are inscribed.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and brown ink, brush and gray, red wash, over black chalk on paper, lined

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
